attributes.description: To exit, take Haymarket Elevator 905 to the Orange Line underpass, then proceed to the end of the hallway and use Haymarket Elevator 906 to access the Green Line platform. At the Green Line platform, turn right and proceed to the lobby and use Haymarket Elevator 908 to access the busway. To board the Orange Line, use the busway to access Haymarket Elevator 908 to the Green Line Platform, then use Elevator 906 to the Orange Line underpass. Take Elevator 905 from the Orange line underpass to the Orange line platform.

attributes.description:
During the station closure, riders may use Bus Routes 441/442 and 455 from Lynn to connect to Wonderland station for continued Blue Line subway service into Boston.

Although Swampscott is a Zone 3 station, Lynn riders who board at Swampscott may purchase Zone 2 tickets and passes.

For more info: MBTA.com/projects/lynn-commuter-rail-station-improvements 



Affected stops:
Lynn
attributes.header: Effective October 1st, Lynn Station is closed in order to be rebuilt as part of the Lynn Commuter Rail Station Improvements Project. A free shuttle bus service is provided between Lynn and Swampscott until a temporary platform is built.

attributes.description: To exit, exit the bus at South Station and proceed to the Airport/Design Center/Chelsea platform, then take an SL1, SL2 or SL3 bus outbound to Courthouse and use Courthouse Elevator 938. To board, use Courthouse Elevator 938 to access the Airport/Design Center/Chelsea platform. Take an SL1, SL2 or SL3 bus outbound to World Trade Center, then proceed to the South Station platform and transfer to an inbound SL1, SL2 or SL3 bus.

attributes.description:
Beginning November 29, the parking lot across from the station will close. Please use the garage or adjacent surface lot as an alternative.

The Quincy Adams Garage drop-off and pick-up location will remain at its location within Level 1B. 

The garage will be PayByPhone / PayByPlate with no need to pay to exit. More information on how to pay for parking is available at mbta.com/parking.

attributes.description: Local GATRA and RIPTA bus service at the station will not be impacted. Riders may also consider Attleboro Station as a temporary alternative.
attributes.header: Commuter Rail service at South Attleboro is temporarily suspended due to significant deterioration of the pedestrian overpass. Service will resume & the pedestrian overpass will reopen when the station Accessibility Improvement Project is fully completed.
attributes.short_header: Commuter Rail service at S Attleboro is temporarily suspended due to significant deterioration of the pedestrian overpass.

attributes.description:
Buses will make stops at Swampscott, Lynn and North Station. 

The regular shuttle service between Lynn and Swampscott implemented due to Lynn station closure On October 1st, 2022, will be suspended during the diversion as the dedicated alternate bus will temporarily stop at Lynn for inbound and outbound service.

There will be no service at Chelsea or River Works.  Passengers at Chelsea may consider a connection with the Silver Line #3 for service to/from South Station.

-A dedicated schedule will be in effect during the disruption and the pdf file is now available on mbta.com
-Buses are accessible, but bikes are not allowed on board.
-Buses are free but passengers are expected to purchase regular fares for travel between Swampscott and their station of origin/destination.
-Regular train service will resume on Wednesday, March 29th.
attributes.header: From Mon, March 20 through Tue, March 28, buses will replace regular weekend & weekday train service between Swampscott & North Station to allow for signal improvement work. Train service will operate between Newburyport/Rockport & Swampscott.
attributes.short_header: From Mon, Mar 20 through Tue, Mar 28, buses will replace regular weekend & weekday train service between Swampscott & N Station.

attributes.short_header: Silver Ln - SL5 omitting the stop on Temple Place on Sat, Mar 18, from 7 AM - 5 PM.

attributes.description:
Normal train service will resume on Monday, March 13th.

-A dedicated schedule is in effect during the disruption. 
-Buses will be  accessible, but bikes will not be allowed on board.
-Buses will be free but passengers are expected to purchase regular fares for travel between Reading and North Station.

Bus pick up and drop off locations:
-Haverhill: on the parking lot, right next to the station shelter -Bradford: on the parking lot, next to the platform ramp
-Lawrence: at 220 Merrimack Street for inbound service. At 211 Merrimack Street for outbound service.
-Andover: at the bus/train shelter on the station side for outbound service, on the other side of Railroad Street for inbound service
-Ballardvale: on the station side of Andover Street for outbound service, on the opposite side of inbound service (next to Spinner Pizza Parlor)
-North Wilmington: On Middlesex Avenue, on the station side just before the sidewalk for inbound service and on the other side of the street, next to the hair salon for outbound service
-Reading: At the MBTA Bus #137 stop on Lincoln street (station side)
attributes.header: Saturday, Mar 4, through Sunday, Mar 12, buses replace trains between Haverhill & Reading to continue signal improvement work as part of the Commuter Rail Safety & Resiliency Program. Train service operates between Reading & North Station.
attributes.short_header: Sat, Mar 4, through Sun, Mar 12, buses will replace train between Haverhill & Reading to continue signal improvement work.

attributes.header: Effective March 12, Rt 553 will have the following changes:
attributes.short_header: Effective March 12, Rt 553 will have the following changes:

attributes.description:
This diversion will allow for work on the East Cottage St & Norfolk Ave bridge replacement project.

On Friday, March 31st and Friday, April 7th, Train 731 will operate via the Franklin Line but will connect with the bus service at Readville for continued service to Forge Park/495. A bus will also accommodate Fairmount Line passengers between South Station and Readville. Check the diversion schedule for more details. 

Buses will be free and accessible, but bikes will not be allowed on board.

Passengers are also invited to consider alternative options to and from:

-Readville - Franklin Line or board MBTA Bus #32 at Hyde Park Ave @ Railroad Station to Forest Hills for an Orange Line connection.

-Fairmount - Providence Line at Hyde Park or board MBTA Bus #24 at Fairmount Ave opp Pierce St to Ashmont for a Red Line connection. MBTA Bus #32 at Hyde Park Ave @ Pingree St to Forest Hills for an Orange Line connection.

-Blue Hill Ave - MBTA Bus #31 at Blue Hill Ave opp Woodhaven St to Forest Hills for an Orange Line Connection. MBTA Bus #24 at River St @ Cummings Hwy to Ashmont for a Red Line connection.

-Morton St - MBTA Bus #21 or #26 at Morton St opp Evans St to Ashmont for a Red Line Connection or take Bus #21 to Forest Hills for an Orange Line connection.

-Talbot Ave - MBTA Bus #22 at Talbot Ave @ Bernard St to Ruggles for an Orange Line connection. Bus 22 at Talbot Ave @ Talbot Station to Ashmont for a Red Line connection.

-Four Corners/Geneva - MBTA Bus #16 at Columbia Rd @ Geneva Ave to Andrew for a Red Line connection. MBTA Bus #17 at Bowdoin St @ Geneva Ave to Andrew for a Red Line connection. MBTA Bus #22, #23, and #28 to Ruggles for an Orange Line connection.

-Uphams Corner - MBTA Bus #16 or #17 at Columbia Rd @ Dudley St to Andrew for a Red Line connection. MBTA Bus #41 at Dudley St @ Uphams Corner Station to JFK/UMass for a Red Line connection.  MBTA Bus # 15 at Dudley St @ Uphams Corner Station to Ruggles for an Orange Line connection.

-Newmarket - MBTA Bus #16 at South Bay Mall @ Allstate Rd to Andrew for a Red Line connection. MBTA Bus # 10 at 1010 Mass Ave opp Magazine St to Andrew for a Red Line connection. MBTA Bus #8 at Massachusetts Ave @ Magazine St to Ruggles for an Orange Line connection.
attributes.header: On weekends, March 31-April 2 & April 7-April 9, starting at 8:45 pm on Friday through the end service on Sunday, buses will replace regular train service between Readville & South Station and operate on a diversion schedule.
attributes.short_header: Weekends, Mar 31-Apr 2 & Apr 7-Apr 9, from 8:45pm on Fri through Sun, buses replace regular train service between South Station & Readville.

attributes.description:
North Avenue entrance and Walnut Street entrance will remain closed until further notice. 

This access change will allow for work on the new platforms as part of Natick Center Station Accessibility Improvements Project.
attributes.header: Effective on Monday, February 13th, and through the end of 2023, the entrances to Natick Center station will be relocated to Washington Street for access to the inbound and outbound platforms.
attributes.short_header: As of on Mon, Feb 13th, & through the end of 2023, the entrances to Natick Center station will be relocated to Washington St.

attributes.description: A shuttle bus will be available, upon request, to transport customers between Oak Grove and Wellington. To exit, exit the train at Wellington and find station personnel or use a station call box to request the shuttle bus to Oak Grove. To board, find station personnel or use a station call box to request the shuttle bus to Wellington. Alternatively, customers may utilize the Oak Grove Elevator 744 located at the station entrance on Washington Street.
